interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Buena Vista Home Video, Hocus Pocus
Review Date: 2016/10/24
Store: Bette Midler  (Actor),     Thora Birch  (Actor),     Kenny Ortega  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, Live Action, All Titles
Product Description: ['You\'re in for a devil of a time when three outlandishly wild witches -- Bette Midler (BEACHES, BIG BUSINESS), Sarah Jessica Parker (HONEYMOON IN VEGAS), and Kathy Najimy (SISTER ACT) -- return from 17th-century Salem after they\'re accidentally conjured up by some unsuspecting pranksters! It\'s a night full of zany fun and comic chaos once the tricky 300-year-old trio sets out to cast a spell on the town and reclaim their youth -- but first they must get their act together and outwit three kids and a talking cat! Loaded with bewitching laughs, HOCUS POCUS is an outrageously wild comedy that\'s sure to entertain everyone!|Producer David Kirschner came up with the idea for the movie one night while he and his young daughter were sitting outside and his neighbor\'s black cat strayed by. Kirschner began to unspool a narrative of how the cat was once a boy who was changed into a feline 300 years ago by three witches.|Actress Kathy Najimy described her character Mary as "Eddie Haskell as a witch," referring to the character on the classic TV series "Leave It To Beaver." "She sucks up to Winifred [Bette Midler\'s character] every chance she gets. She wants to be part of the power club and Winifred\'s got the power."|To create the costumes, designer Mary Vogt read many historical books about Salem, Massachusetts. "I even read diaries of women who were hanged as witches," she says.']
Average Rating: 4.8

Review Text: A classic
Review Title: Four Stars
Rating: 4.0

It's ok
Three Stars
Graffiti Bridge
Prince  (Actor, Director, Writer),     Morris Day  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Music Artists, Prince
['Product Description', 'Graffiti Bridge (DVD)', 'In a sequel of sorts to Purple Rain, the artist formerly known as Princestruggles musically with Morris Day for control of the nightclub thatthe two co-own in this dramatic musical fantasy. There is the power offaith--in oneself and in a higher power. There is the power of love.There is the never-ending struggle between good and bad. And there isthe power of music. Graffiti Bridge.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "A sort of fairy-tale sequel to Prince's enormously successful", 'Purple Rain', ", 1990's", 'Graffiti Bridge', "finds his purple highness not only singing and acting, but writing and directing, too. His performance suffers on all fronts. The film isn't a disaster, but it's safe to predict completist fans will make up most of its viewers. In the earlier film, Prince (known as the Kid) was fighting for his place on stage. This time he's fighting to keep his club safe from the money-grubbing hands of his musical rival, the Time's Morris Day, now a nightclub mogul. Day embodies spiritual, sexual, and economic corruption, while the Kid stands for salvation through music and a more redemptive form of lust.", 'The graffiti bridge conceit--a metaphor for a place of rejuvenation and artistic inspiration--is intriguing. Unfortunately, the bridge itself is merely a prop in a Paisley Park soundstage. Where', 'Purple Rain', 'was a movie that set new standards for lensing musical performances,', 'Graffiti Bridge', 'feels like a music video masquerading as a movie. Lucky for us, Prince cast the honey-voiced poet and performer Ingrid Chavez as Aura, part muse and part angel to both Day and the Kid. Her beauty and charisma ignite every frame she graces.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'Set Contains:', 'Bonus features are minimal but apt: a surprisingly good movie trailer and a quartet of relevant music videos, three drawn from the film and one, "Question of U," a characteristically electric concert clip.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'See more']

Movies & TV, Music Artists, Prince
['Under The Cherry Moon (DVD)', "Worldwide musical sensation Prince stars in this offbeat love story of two young people who fight to stay together. Scheming to get rich quick, Christopher (Prince) and his friend Tricky travel to the French Riviera. But Christopher's plans go awry when he falls madly in love with a beautiful, spoiled heiress whose parents plot to keep them apart.", ']]>']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary**

- **Commitment to Quality and Nostalgia**: The user continues to showcase a discerning taste, recently awarding a strong rating to a nostalgic classic. This reinforces their overall average rating now at 4.1, highlighting a consistent pursuit of high-quality content.

- **Appreciation for Whimsical Narratives**: Their recent engagement with lighthearted comedic narratives reflects a willingness to explore more playful, entertaining storytelling. This contrasts yet complements their longstanding preference for deeper, emotionally complex themes, showing versatility in their viewing habits.

- **Emotional and Cultural Connection**: The user remains deeply engaged with narratives that balance laughter with emotional resonance, proving their interest in content that can evoke both joy and deeper societal reflections.

- **Open to Diverse Formats**: Their ongoing exploration of various formats, including whimsical and family-friendly content, signals an expanding acceptance of diverse storytelling methods while maintaining a focus on emotional depth.

- **Interest in Music and Performance**: The user’s connection to narratives that include musical elements or showmanship is consistent, underscoring an appreciation for artistic expression that resonates on multiple emotional levels.

Overall, the user illustrates an evolving trajectory that embraces both high-quality, emotionally rich narratives and entertaining, imaginative storytelling, reflecting diversified tastes while maintaining a core appreciation for artistic integrity and cultural value.
